intro: Collabium annamense, commonly known as the Annamese collabium, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Meliaceae, which includes mahogany and related trees. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered flowers and heart-shaped leaves. It typically grows in moist, tropical forests and is often found in the understory vegetation. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
